newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil unions meet labor minister in jobs row.
newsitem.headline: Brazil unions meet labor minister in jobs row.

text.p: Leaders of Brazil's Sao Paulo Metal Workers Union and the Forca Sindical labor federation met Labor Minister Paulo Paiva Wednesday to press for greater job protection in the car parts industry, officials said.
The Folha de Sao Paulo newspaper said the union leaders had threatened to "shut down" Santos port, Brazil's key sugar exporting port if they were not satisfied after their talks with Paiva.
"We are going to get radical," Folha quoted Paulo Pereira da Silva, head of the Metal Workers Union, as saying.
Labor Ministry officials could not immediately confirm that the labor representatives had delivered the threat over Santos to the minister and the union leaders could not be reached for comment.

According to Folha, the unions claim the car parts industry is being decimated by unemployment following a move last year to reduce car part import tariffs to two percent from 18 percent. The unions are demanding the tariff be raised.
